intro: Castalia versicolor, commonly known as the variable castalia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with five petals that can range in color from white to pink and purple, depending on the variety. Castalia versicolor is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
